Detta är en sida om odling av körsbär.

![Prunus Cesarus](prunus_cesarus.jpg)

Genus (släkte): _Prunus_ (plommon, körsbär, aprikoser mfl)
Subgenus (undersläkte): _Prunus subg. Cesarus_ (körsbär)
Species (art): _Prunus cesarus_ (surkörsbär) och _Prunus avium_ (sötkörsbär)
Subspecies (underart): Tex _Prunus avium subsp. avium_
Varietas (variant): Tex _Prunus avium var. juliana_ (Hjärtkörsbär), _Prunus avium var. avium_ (Vanlig sötkörsbär), _Prunus avium var. duracina_ (Bigarrå).

"Sort": Tex _Prunus avium_ 'Merton Glory'. Kallas ibland "kultivar" när den framkorsats medvetet.

Släktnamnet skrivs med stor bokstav och artnamnet med liten.

subg.
sp.
subs. = ssp.
var. = f. [form] = v.

## Varför plantera flera sorter?

Some are suitable for cooking and others best eaten straight off the tree. Secondly, growing multiple varieties allows you to ensure a steady supply of cherries throughout the warmer months.  Thirdly,  you can never know how well a  particular variety will do in your garden, so it is always worth experimenting. Lastly, some varieties are resistant to cracking, which usually occurs during summer rains.

## Surkörsbär ("Amarell"), skillnad mot sötkörsbär


Morello cherry trees fruit on younger wood than sweet varieties, and thus can be pruned harder.

 Trees will do badly if waterlogged, but have greater tolerance of poor drainage than sweet varieties.

demand more nitrogen and water than sweet cherries

Sour cherries suffer fewer pests and diseases than sweet cherries

sour cherries are self fertile
